intro: Cynometra laxiflora, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and large, compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and timber use, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
